gw.transaction

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.transaction.Transaction

  • public class Transaction
extends Object
    Helper class used to get the current transaction bundle or to start a new bundle transaction.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Bundle Current
      Returns the current transaction bundle. If the current transaction isn't set then null is returned.

      Many execution contexts contain a default bundle (PCF files, non-validation rules, background processes, web services, etc...).

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Transaction()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Bundle getCurrent()
      Returns the current transaction bundle. If the current transaction isn't set then null is returned.

      Many execution contexts contain a default bundle (PCF files, non-validation rules, background processes, web services, etc...).
      static Bundle newBundle()
      Creates a new entity bundle. This is an alternative to {@link #runWithNewBundle(gw.transaction.Transaction.BlockRunnable)} for cases when the caller needs more control over when, if ever, the bundle is committed.
      static void runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable block, String username)
      Runs the specified block using a new bundle with the user identified by the given username set as the active user.
      static void runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable block, User user)
      Runs the specified block using a new bundle with the given user set as the active user.
      static void runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
      Runs the specified block using a new bundle.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • Current

        Bundle Current
        Returns the current transaction bundle. If the current transaction isn't set then null is returned.

        Many execution contexts contain a default bundle (PCF files, non-validation rules, background processes, web services, etc...).

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrent

        Bundle getCurrent()
        Returns the current transaction bundle. If the current transaction isn't set then null is returned.

        Many execution contexts contain a default bundle (PCF files, non-validation rules, background processes, web services, etc...).

        Returns:
        the current bundle

      • newBundle

        Bundle newBundle()
        Creates a new entity bundle. This is an alternative to {@link #runWithNewBundle(gw.transaction.Transaction.BlockRunnable)} for cases when the caller needs more control over when, if ever, the bundle is committed.
        Returns:

      • runWithNewBundle

        void runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable block,
                    String username)
        Runs the specified block using a new bundle with the user identified by the given username set as the active user.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to run
        username - the username to run as

      • runWithNewBundle

        void runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable block,
                    User user)
        Runs the specified block using a new bundle with the given user set as the active user.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to run
        user - the user to run as

      • runWithNewBundle

        void runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
        Runs the specified block using a new bundle.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to run
